Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Flair4GoldBranin
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three day jaunt up to Chicago. At first I was scared as to what type of hotel I would get for only $70 in downtown Chicago. BUT, I was very impressed. First, the room was a suite with a full kitchen, king size bed and everything one could want. Secondly, there was free wifi and the windows opened! I love that. Being it the windy city, a nice breeze coming through at nice was great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: BeachTravel114
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is close to shopping, the lake and the finest restaurants in town, this is the place. A short cab ride will get you to a Bears, Bulls or Hawks game and if you want to go to a Sox game or to see that other National League team in town, you can always take your car in and out of valet as often as you like without an additional charge. The $47 a day valet charge isn't cheap, but at least you have some flexibility and the car stays on site. The hotel is a short walk to Gino's East, Magnificent Mile Shopping, Navy Pier, etc. and there is plenty of night life in the area because this is also the gold coast area of Chicago with plenty of high rise condos. The hotel offers a free breakfast in the morning and your kitchen is fully stocked so you can prepare meals or just have some breakfast food on hand for the mornings. It's like staying in a studio or one bedroom apartment in the high rent area, without the high price.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here everytime we go to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Whasabae
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. 1 city block off of Magnificent Mile shopping. Close to Cheesecake Factory, H&M, 900 Shopping Plaza, Watertower place and in view of the lake. There were four of us ladies who went for an overnight shopping/sight seeing weekend via Amtrak. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite. 1 King, 1 Queen and a sofa sleeper, full kitchen and living room. Great view! Quite. Free breakfast buffet offers everything from cereal and yogurt to eggs and make your own waffles. Staff is friendly and they worked with us and our train schedule which required an early check in and a late check out. Total cost for hotel stay for 1 night, $345. Will always stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Spacious Room.”
Reviews.Author: Karkman
Reviews.Content: I love the Marriott Chain and this hotel was very good. My wife and I were in town to celebrate her birthday and you cannot beat the location to restaurants, shopping and entertainment. THe room was clean and spacious except for the closet space and bathroom sink area. Those were way to small compared to the rest of the room. Good solid hotel and the staff was Great.

Reviews.Title: “One word, awesome!”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; 1 bedroom suite with kitchen Stats: Beds; comfy Bathroom; clean but unusually tiny. Room size; large, surprisingly large for an inner city room , with full kitchen. Check in; Professional, our room wasn't ready cause we were early but we pre checked in and were called by the hotel as soon as it was ready. Overall impression; Awesome. The room was large and comfortable, it was like a home away from home. The breakfast was delicious on both mornings and the convenience of it makes sense when you consider most mornings were below freezing so a trek to find breakfast would be tough. The thing that made this place was the staff, nothing was too much trouble, the ladies looking after the breakfast, the reception staff and bell staff were all outstanding. Would recommend this hotel without any concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great For Kids”
Reviews.Author: Rod_Houston
Reviews.Content: For our annual Thanksgiving trip to Chicago we elected to stay at a hotel this past year rather than the in-laws as we have in the past. Nothing wrong with the in-laws of course but as our family has grown quarters have grown tight at their house so we felt it was time to branch out. I can say after spending 4 nights at the Residence Inn in downtown Chicago we made an excellent choice. The location is fantastic. Right by Michigan Avenue. A few blocks from the lake. Just right in the heart of Chicago. I was actually shocked by how cheap we were able to get the room considering the location and the holiday weekend but I wasn't going to argue. The room was huge. Plenty of space for our family of 4 to spread out. With two toddler age kids room to roam is important and they had plenty of room to play. The free breakfast was good. Nothing historic but it met expectations. The one downside I will point out is parking is a bit expensive. While the parking was high the valet attendants were very friendly and moved quickly when you needed your car. We are planning another trip for later this year where we are bringing some friends and are going to highly recommending the Residence Inn on Walton to them. Great value. Great location. Great service. And tons of room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marc237
Reviews.Content: Went to this Hotel for a weekend and found the room to be neat and clean. We had a king bed suite with a kitchen. Service was very good and the people were very nice. Breakfast was so-so. we did not eat any other meals there. The Hotel store had a good variety of "Stuff" should you need something. It's close to all the shopping and the rates are very good. Solid four out of five.

Reviews.Title: “Heat control would be nice.”
Reviews.Author: Shep8
Reviews.Content: We just spent two days at this Residence Inn. The room was huge by Chicago hotel standards. The facility was very clean. The one problem that we encountered was heat control. Even with the heat turned off we had to open a window to cool the room for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “its a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: Its a clean hotel ,its in price range and it offers free wi-fi. its one block away from michigan avenue and 20 min walk from navy pier. the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JonRobert
Reviews.Content: After arriving to the wrong hotel, the front desk manager changed my reservation for me and greeted me with a smile. I had arrived about 25 minutes after the complimentary dinner was served and the kitchen host went above and beyond and made me a plate to take to my room. The next morning I over slept and caught the last the few mins of breakfast and the host helped me wrap my plate and carried my food upstairs for me. Everyone at the hotel was nice and very and friendly. Magnificent Mile was at my doorstep, which was a shoppers delight. Please reward your staff, as a Manager I know how important the small things are, and your staff and hotel got it all right thanks for making my first CHI town experiance a great one : )

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: IowaTraveler76
Reviews.Content: This is a mid-century building that has been updated very well. The rooms are all the same, sleeping 4 comfortably, MAX. The kitchenette is nice. The lobby area was great for our group and we used it a lot for gathering. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly, getting us ice for our cooler. The breakfast here is actually very good, and included in the price! The location is right off Michigan Avenue's north end. Awesome place, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: GioAndJen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable, and the staff were friendly. The free breakfast included a range of choices like eggs, waffles, toast, cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, and yogurt. This hotel is conveniently located around the Magnificent Mile, just a block away from the John Hancock Center. I have nothing at all negative to stay and would definitely stay there again the next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn Chicago Downtown”
Reviews.Author: nurse_michelle
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 of my girlfriends stayed at the Residence this past weekend for a mini weekend get away. The staff was wonderful, they accomodated all my needs. The rooms were nice. They had a full kitchen and comfortable beds. The hotel was very busy when we were there and we still had no problem getting into our room quickly and getting through the buffett breakfast line in a timely manner. The location of this hotel is awesome and at a great price. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Janet B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights in July of 2011. It was our first trip to Chicago, and we had a great time! It's in an awesome location, very close to everything! Only 1 block away from the John Hancock Observatory. Loved having the little kitchen and living area, worked out great with the kids. Free breakfast was good - something for everyone! Staff was great, would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Tillie03
Reviews.Content: Great location..1/2 block to North Michigan Ave. We stayed in the Studio which was big and had a full kitchen (no oven in the Studio) with stove top, microwave, refrigerator, dish washer,etc. A very extensive free breakfast. As stated by other reviewers the elevators are slow during peak times of the breakfast buffet but the management tells you that in literature in the room. I prefer a bathtub but the shower was modern with a rain forest shower. The room was very inexpensive ($109.00) but that is because it was January in Chicago. The rates are much more for the summer. 4 1/2 blocks to the metro (the El) and we took the metro to and from O'Hare Airport with good directions from the front desk. The one way price of the metro to O'Hare was $2.50..unbelievable. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: neoncheer
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Great location, walking distance to so much. The staff was helpful and wonderful. The room was a nice size. The toilet and shower are separate from the sink and mirror area, which is nice when 2 people need to get ready to go out. My only complaints about the room were that the temperature control isn't very good. We had to open a window to get the room under 71 degrees (In January!) also, there isn't very much storage, if you like to unpack. The room was very clean and well appointed, though. We loved having a kitchen! The free breakfast every morning was nice too. We will definitely be back for our next Chicago trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: picole
Reviews.Content: Close to everywhere by public transportation, staff very friendly, breakfast included, the room was clean, large and pretty. We already have plans to come back to Chicago and we will stay in the same hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay, even if it was short”
Reviews.Author: Luvtravels33
Reviews.Content: My room was larger than some of my apartments! This is a beautiful, clean, affordable hotel within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The staff is friendly, and the breakfast was terrific. I stayed one night for a business trip, and everything was easy from check-in to baggage check and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic bargain in Chi Town”
Reviews.Author: Mullettlk
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, well priced and well located hotel in Chicago-go here. Just off Michigan Ave. it has a great location and the rooms are very well appointed including kitchens. More space in these rooms that other "full size" hotels. Very friendly and helpful staff rounds out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Marriott a bad name....”
Reviews.Author: eli220
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I have stayed at dozens of Marriott hotels in the past 5 years. I was platinum elite for a number of years until I started taking my business elsewhere and this hotel is a prime example as to why. The customer service is not just lacking but nonexistent. The valet ripped the key out of my mothers car while it was still in park and left her stranded at the hotel for hours. The shuttle bus driver was so rude and wreckless that my mother actually got out of the vehicle before reaching her destination. While trying to resolve this situation I was given nothing but nonchalant attitude like I was the one inconveniencing them. Even after speaking to the regional manager, Jamie, I received nothing but excuse after excuse and an "I'm sorry". Our claims department will be contacting you. He spoke to me as if I was lying about his employees "she would never do that" "he's the top in his business" & "we have the highest reviews". I was once very dedicated loyal customer to Marriott and have had numerous wonderful experiences in their hotels both in the states and abroad but this was the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in and has the most unprofessional & inconsiderate employees I have ever encountered. I'd highly recommend taking your business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, large rooms, close to mag mile”
Reviews.Author: minitor
Reviews.Content: You're about 1 block from the Mag Mile. If you enjoy shopping, this is the place to stay. Near beaches too, if it's summer walk across to Oak Street Beach. The free breakfast is typical for a Residence Inn but unusual for Downtown Chicago. You are a quick bus ride away from Wrigley Field or go the other way and you are minutes from the Art Museum, Grant Park and The Bean. Staff is efficient, not particularly warm. Elevators are slow on weekends, plan to eat early if you don't want to wait at breakfast/checkout time. Large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Beds :)”
Reviews.Author: Gaby B
Reviews.Content: Well , i looooooove this hotel, i went with my boyfriend for a couple of days in July it was awesome :) i mean our view was not the greatest because we had a horrible roof right next to the window but inside everything was lovely, we booked a junior suite that we really enjoyed ;) Ill recommend you that type of room, but try to request a high floor! The only think We dislike was the advice that the Frontdesk guy gave us, we asked him about a nice italian restaurant and he send us to a weird place! but..thats ok nobodys perfect! ill def want to come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location and massive space”
Reviews.Author: skippyLuzern
Reviews.Content: What a great location, quiet and convenient and easy to get to by car once you work out how to enter Walton Street! Lack of short term street parking and expensive valet service is the only down side I can comment on but the space and amenity in the one bedroom apartment was amazing, apart from the squeeze in the bathroom, and the staff were extremely attentive and helpful; my 3 year old grandson was delighted with his backpack surprise from the front desk. The complimentary breakfast was just fine and we took helpings back to our room to have a nice undisturbed family meal around the table with our own plates, cutlery and kitchen facilities. The $149 for the Sunday night was exceptional value and I would not hesitate to return if this kind of rate is available again. This property is not about luxury but location, amenity, space, value and more than adequate comfort. We had dinner at the Rosebud across the road for a party of 8 and enjoyed great service but it was all at quite a price, especially the wines.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it lots!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieHighland
Reviews.Content: Although I work in Chicago, I decided to use my free nightâ€™s stay at the Residence Inn, just a block off Michigan Avenue, the main shopping street, two weeks before Christmas to do a little spending. I knew the location would be excellent, but I was surprised at the size of the (upgraded) one-bedroom suite we stayed in. The bedroom was ridiculously large, and my nephew says the pull-out couch was comfortable in the living room. And he had his own TV, as did I. The closet by the door was very large as were the two huge closets in the bedroom â€“ as much closet space as I have in my townhouse! I liked the separate sink, and everything was very clean and the staff friendly. The 900 Michigan shops and Water Tower place are with two blocks. Canâ€™t beat it for shopping. The breakfast was your typically good RI variety, AND we had a woman breakfast attendant who sang a Blues song about the RI during breakfast! Free entertainment! You wonâ€™t regret your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Location”
Reviews.Author: Sbroadhog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting our daughter for a long Chicago weekend and Residence Inn fit the bill. You could not ask for a better location a block from the lake and a block from Michigan Ave. where all the action is. We arrived after a long flight and commute to downtown exhausted. The front desk could not have been more accomodating finding us a great room to help celebrate my wife's birthday. The elevators are a little slow and small but small inconvenience for a quite property. Breakfast each morning was a delight with fresh fruit selection, hot & cold cereals, hot entrees, pastries, etc. , just a great selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: B777Boeing
Reviews.Content: As an airline crew member I stay here very often. Great location and amazing breakfast! Three days out of the week they have great dinners. Unfortunately the staff is less than friendly and rarely go out of the way to make their customers happy.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: momwantstotravel
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal on this hotel by booking early and using our AAA discount. It was a large one bedroom suite. It came with a well equipped kitchen (although I did nothing more than microwave or heat leftovers). The living room was large and had beautiful views of the lake from two directions. Our bedroom was very big, it held a king size bed and a rollaway bed for our daughter. The hotel provides a generous breakfast each morning. We ate down there each day. They provide plenty of healthy options. You do need to go early on crowded days. There is coffee available all day long. There was dinner provided, but we never made it for dinner. The location is fantastic. You can walk to the red line. We also walked along the lake path for exercise. It is one and a half blocks off Michigan, and around the corner from the Hancock and Water Tower Place. If you want decent food for your room, if you walk over to Rush Street across the street from the Talbott Hotel is a great little shop called The Goddess and The Grocer. You can pick up snacks for dinner or bakery treats. Try to get a high floor- we were room 1803 and I have posted pics of our great view! Million dollar view on a teacher budget! Yay! It was very clean and well kept. The bathroom was small, but not a huge deal. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay one block off the Magnificent Mile-Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I recently visited Chicago for a shopping trip. Marriott offered a a great rate at this property, so we took a chance and booked it. Everything about our stay was perfect! We were upgraded from a studio to a king suite. The room was larger than my first apartment! Everything was extremely clean, well appointed and quiet. We asked for a lower floor to avoid the elevator delays mentioned in other reviews, but never had to wait. The room had a full kitchen and breakfast is included (we slept in and ate out). The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is one block from the 900 Shops, 2 blocks from Watertower Place Tower shopping and the American Girl store, and a short walk from Oak Street shops. The only slight negatives-parking is $45/night, which is typical for downtown Chicago, but service is fast. Wireless Internet is free, but a bit slow. The rooms have baseboard heating and you can't control the thermostat. We regulated the room temperature by opening a window. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: SlickToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a long weekend in Chicago and were blown away by the front desk staff. From checking in to buying architectural boat tour and museum tickets to giving directions to going two streets down the block to help us get a cab when none was available, they were amazing and always super friendly. The suite was spacious, the mattress was very comfortable, and the place was well cleaned. Our only complaints were that the suite furniture in the living room was a little ragged and the bed pillows could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient spot, great service, good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JGinA2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our anniversary in Chicago, and I found this hotel to be really well located for sightseeing and shopping. The studio suite was a reasonable size, kitchen with everything you might need, but we didn't use it much. The bed was very comfortable, and the windows open a bit for some fresh air at night which I really appreciate. We had a handicapped-accessible room (because it was what was available at check-in) and the bathroom was huge as a result. Don't know what the normal bath is like, so I can't comment on that, but everything was spotlessly clean and the room was made up very well every day. Don't know where the previous reviewer ate, but we found the breakfast plentiful and tasty. Hot items varied each day, and there is a waffle maker, oatmeal, cold cereal, baked goods...and though there were lots of people each time we went down there seemed always to be enough seating. Free internet in the room...I would not recommend waiting for the two stations I noticed in the breakfast area (kids were playing games on them most of the time). We drove into town and the hotel parking was very convenient if you want your car for trips around town. Staff was very polite and helpful. I can't think of anything that was off at this place! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a shining star in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: circuitdogg
Reviews.Content: The concept is great but this hotel had awful beds, postage stamp size pillows, I asked for a duvet and was handed a ratty old blanket, the breakfast was minimal at best, not enough newspapers for guests staying at the hotel and finally.. a call to a taxi company outside 312 area code for 2 mins was a whopping $5.00. I'd take a pass on this hotel as usually a five star can be had for same amount 300. per night elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Older building but it's been updated”
Reviews.Author: shethang
Reviews.Content: I stay in Residence Inns for business travel quite a bit. I was in this one for three nights. I was on 18th floor and had a nice lake view. Although the building is older, the property has been decently updated. The kitchen had updated appliances and fixtures. The bathroom was also updated, with a glass walled stand up shower stall rather than a tub with a curtain (a plus in my book). The sink vanity space in my studio room was small, little room to put out makeup and toiletries. Room cleanliness wasn't terrible, but it wasn't top notch either. There was a hair on the shower floor when I checked in. I also had to wipe off the bed nightstand as soon as I checked in because it wasn't clean, outlined remnants of food or drink sitting there remained. There was a small mystery stain on the couch I also had to spot clean with a damp washcloth because it skeeved me out. It was 50-some degrees outside during daytime when I was at the hotel, and radiant baseboard heat seemed to be on in my room. Per a sign by the room thermostat, it said to cool the room by opening the windows. I had windows open during my whole stay. No screens on them, but not a problem with bugs during November. It just got a bit noisy sometimes for sleeping when sirens would go off. I was glad I was not closer to street level. Service was efficient at the front desk. Valet attendants were friendly. The gym was clean but small with only two treadmills and two ellipticals, one older and without a TV on it. The whole hotel lost power one night at about 11:30 pm, but to their credit it was repaired and back on within about five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Home in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: Sortova
Reviews.Content: When I come to Chicago, I always stay at the Blackstone. I love that hotel, so I have never thought to look elsewhere. I also love Chicago, and never pass up a chance to visit. When my wife had a conference at the Four Seasons, I decided to come with her, and being a loyal Marriott patron I booked this hotel, which was just a few block away (the conference hotel was too pricey). For those who aren't familiar, Residence Inn is an apartment/extended stay brand of the Marriott chain. Our one bedroom suite contained a small kitchen, a living room and a separate bedroom. In fact, it was larger than many apartments I rented when I was younger. When I came into the lobby and got in the elevator, I could see that the brass around the doors had seen a lot of wear. I was expecting to see some signs of age in the rooms, but they must have been renovated recently because they were in fine shape. We stayed four nights and had a very pleasant time. The hotel is located right in the heart of the "magnificent mile". We bought a three day CTA pass and had no problems getting around either by bus or on the L. It was close to shopping, the lake and museums. They're aren't many downsides. One is that the elevators are older and a bit slow, so expect a wait, especially during busy times. The breakfast buffet was just okay, your standard eggs, sausage, muffins, etc. I would have preferred more fruit. The Internet service (free of charge) was worth every penny (grin) but worked acceptably most of the time. If you are looking for a nice lake view, this hotel isn't for you, as it is several blocks from the water and there is a large building between it and the lake. I still prefer the Blackstone, but if location is ever an issue (as it was this trip) I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location + Residence Inn Quality = Great Stay, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: FrancisUrquhart
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn just off the Magnificent Mile is a fabulous location for being in the heart of Chicago's shopping, business, and entertainment districts. The building was situated so that you got very little street noise, at least from my room 1108. The street is quiet but you are just around the corner from all the glitter and excitement of the Magnificent Mile. The Residence Inn was your standard variety Residence Inn with its usual very good quality and excellent value for money. They honored U.S. Federal Government per diem rates, so it was an excellent value to get a suite for $190 per night in the heart of downtown . Everything was very clean and the one bedroom suite was spacious. The mattress was a bit soft but not so it hurt my back. They had the usual wonderful Residence Inn hollofil pillows that seem to act like feather pillows--don't know how they do this or where I could get some for home but I really like them. The furniture was beginning to show signs of wear (especially on the arm chair armrests) but not unless you looked carefully. The staff were extraordinarily friendly and helpful. The location was wonderful and Chicago is a very walkable city, so I took full advantage of walking to the many great shops, stores, and restaurants after my meetings were finished. It was also convenient to public transport buses and subways. I could walk to a Trader Joe's, and there's a full service post office in the building of the John Hancock Center, which is just around the corner. A 24-hour Walgreens is also close by. Filene's Basement, Nordstrom Rack, the Disney Store, and an Apple Store were all within a few blocks. A Chipotle restaurant was a bit further walk but under 15 minutes. Everything was so convenient The breakfast was standard Residence Inn fare, which is to say it was high quality and abundant, but like every other Residence Inn the coffee is a bit ordinary. There was plenty of seating during the morning rush hour of buffet grazers. I was not there for the evening meal, so I can't comment on that. They do not have a business center with computer access like some Residence Inns. I was not traveling with my computer so I could not take advantage of their free wi-fi broadband service. The gym appeared basic but all the machines seemed clean and in good working order. All in all, a solid hotel in a superb location made for a great stay and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Super- what you sign up for you get, space comfort and a central location”
Reviews.Author: zuperzigy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel came recommended from friends who live nearby. Suites are spacious - very very clean .The V Triangle and the Magnificent Mile are a stone throw away. but the Hotel is quiet at night and the units well insulated .I recommend choosing a high flooor facing the back to avoid the almost nonexistent street noise - you can open the window slides and enjoy a good nights rest without recycled aircon air. Bed is huge and comfy 2 TVs in Lounge and Bedroom. Hotel is in typical slightly tacky Marriot brass and wood decor but gets a facelift at the moment so there maybe some changes coming. Breakfast is ok , the excercise room is lame. I did walk up Walton St to Equinox sign up for a day pass - beautiful gym !

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price through priceline”
Reviews.Author: zoomzoomguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to everything, but on a quiet street. Great room and the kitchen added a nice touch. I spent three days here for a conference at another hotel and saved a bunch. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: SuperSueB
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago to celebrate my husband's birthday. This hotel has a great location for walking around downtown Chicago. Good service from front desk. They knew our flight number and had our room ready before regular check-in time without our asking. A very loud TV next door was dealt with swiftly and efficiently. Good breakfast though I would have liked biscuits with my eggs. (Oh, well. Chicago isn't the South.) Comfortable, efficiently appointed room. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: Just completed a three day stay at this hotel. Upside was that the location is perfect, 1 1/2 blocks off Michigan Ave., and one block from Lake Michigan. On a quiet street (Walton) which gets virtually no traffic. Staff was very friendly, especially Mark at the front desk. Breakfast is included and is standard Residence Inn fare. Room was pretty standard as well except that I noticed the rooms around mine were bigger. I was on the 15th floor and it was quiet.. Internet was free, parking was $45 but I didn't have a car. On the downside, the rooms don't have safes, which most Chicago hotels I have stayed at do; and the elevators are a little smaller and slower than some of the other hotels. Workout room was "standard." a few Precor cardio machines, a few dumbbells but no mats or stretching equipment. I was told that I could use the Marriott at 540 N. Michigan which I checked out. It had more cardio equipment but no weights. On the dining side, I ate one night at the Rosebud Steakhouse across the street. It was very good. Also, I used the GO shuttle to get to O'hare airport and it was $29 vs. $45 for a cab. If I got the same good rate, I would most likely stay here again. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “A BOUTIQUE, GOOD LOCATION AND VALUE - FULL SERVICE HOTEL, ONE BLOCK FROM MICHIGAN AVE. - MAGNIFICIENT MILE”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELWITHFAF
Reviews.Content: This is a well managed boutique full service hotel very near Michigan Ave. Chicago's Magnificient Mile of EVERYTHING. There are three small elevators (capacity of about six/seven passengers each), one of which is for pets. Yes, in addition to being family friendly it is also pet friendly. The valet/bell captain outside front entrance even has bowls with dog biscuits for the pets. Valet car service is expensive $45.00 / night.The front service desk representative is also the conceige. There is taxi service in front of the hotel. The hotel is situated away from the hustle and bustle of Michigan avenue, in a quiet residential-apartment-condo neighborhood area. There is no lounge or bar service. But that is ok, each room suite has a full refrigerator kitchenette and dining area. On arrival our standard suite was not ready, so we were upgraded to a deluxe 2 Bedroom suite. The kitchenette, living and dining area, master bedroom, second bedroom, closets, and cabinets, dressers gave the traveler a feeling of living in a condo apartment. There were three 35 inch flat screen televisions (one in each bedroom and the living room). The main drawback, and reason that my overall rating is a four (very good) and not a five(excellent) is because of the bathroom. Our bathroom was so small it seemed to be the size of our pantry at home. The sink was located outside of the toliet and combination tub and shower. When you were using the toliet,you were very close, almost on top of the tub/shower. There was a door to the area of the toliet/tub/shower for privacy, but most of the time you kept it open because of the close quarters. So, when I was at the sink, the door knob kept hitting me on the back side. On one occassion I must have slammed the door shut to hard because it locked from the inside. Fortunately, all of our business had been taken care of before the door locked. We notified the front desk, and when we returned three hours later, maintenance had the door opened. Thereafter during our four night stay we were more carefull when using the sink. On one occasion I stayed in the suite, while housekeeping was attending to the suite. I could not believe the thourghness of the staff. UNBELIEVABLE! In addition to the regular cleaning they polished all mirrors, mirror frames, picures, picture frames, tables, and counters. Washed all dishes, cleaned and pollished the refrigerator, microwave, stove, kitchen sink. AND cleaned and polished all tile flooring on the bathroom and kitchen floors on hands and knees!

Reviews.Title: “All you could need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linnybee
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a central, reasonably priced, comfortable hotel in the heart of Chicago than the Residence Inn might be a good bet for you. My husband and I stayed in a suite that had a kitchenette, a living area, and a king size bed. The kitchen is fully stocked with all the equipment and supplies you need to make meals (and eat them) in your room. We didn't use the kitchen very much because there was a complimentary breakfast downstairs and we just grabbed some lunch and dinner out during our explorations of Chicago. It was nice to have the fridge to keep drinks in and a microwave to make popcorn in. The bed and bedding was clean and comfortable and the room and ensuite were very spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only minor downside is that the nearest metro stop is a little far away but, most of the time we walked everywhere anyway so that was only a very minor drawback. Overall, we were very satisfied with the price of the Residence Inn and the quality of the amenities included in that price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KenF88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here whenever we are in town, and it is always a great experience. Clean, quiet, and right in the middle of everything. Highly reccommended (and I am a nit-pickey traveler!)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: MoscowPavel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel just 1 night in may 2010. The location is superb - you can walk everywhere in a Chicago Loop. We were pleasantly surprised with the room's quality and amenities. We stayed in a studio suite with kitchen - very spacious, and quiet . The bed was extremly comfortable and linen&pillows were high quality. Bathroom was at the same high level. We've been very well met upon arrival on a reception - special thanks to one Lady (the only I remember that is she was from Bulgaria). Breakfast was delicious with wide selection of food. We asked to turn to sport channel broadcasted tennis (French Open final Live) and spent a very good time. Also we'd like to thank the person who drove us to airport. Excellent hotel with reasonable price. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: aajarvis
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for walking to the river front attractions. Modern Marriott, upscale, comfortable, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: momruns2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a girls weekend. The room was great and the hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again for the breakfast alone. It was great to be able to walk downstairs and have breakfast available. We had a great view of the lake. The price was great, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Family Vacation Location”
Reviews.Author: South_Pasadena_1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 2 bedroom suite which was generously sized for a family of 4, with a large living room area. Plenty of restaurants and shopping very nearby including a couple of small markets. Easy walk to Michigan Avenue and Water Tower, a little farther to red line subway. Very slow elevators (apartment building conversion to RI?). Average RI breakfast. Front desk staff was very helpful, good suggestions. Parking is the only downside, expensive and lightly staffed valet service, sometimes a long wait for car. Overall great for families and walking visit to Magnificent Mile and Hicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value!”
Reviews.Author: BostonChik85
Reviews.Content: I just spent Six Lovely Days in Chicago at this Hotel. The Location was perfect. Only a few blocks from Michigan Ave and the Oak Street Beach Street. We stayed on the 6th floor in a one bedroom suite. We didn't encounter any noise problems and our floor was relatively quiet. The Breakfast was suburb. You get a lot of options which is nice. The hotel isn't too far from Subway Stop Clark Street or Chicago. The "L" is the easiest way to get around the city. You don't need a car at all. It costs $45/day for valet. I noticed that Chicago is very dog friendly. Pets are welcome at this hotel and they have their own elevator. I recommend Navy Pier, Museum of Contemporary Art, Water Tower Place, and Oak Street Beach. Also for easy transportation to and from the airport, do "Go Airport Express Vans", It's around $60 roundtrip. The vans take you right to O'hare or Midway. You can also take the subway out to the airport on the blue line which takes 45 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbotkin
Reviews.Content: great location, easy to walk to many attractions or catch a taxi. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and reasonably priced... A+!!”
Reviews.Author: I_luv_vacays
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three other women for a girls weekend in one of the two-bedroom suites and it was fantastic! The room was very nice, extremely spacious and was a great value! The free buffet breakfast provided a lot of options and was very tasty! The staff was very nice and helpful in making recommendations, getting us cabs and anything else we needed. The location was great for shopping, going to the lake and going to the Hancock Tower. I really don't have any complaints at all about this hotel and would definitely stay there on my next trip to Chicago!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Maybe too far north for my desires?”
Reviews.Author: MetroMatch
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two adults and towk kids 9 and under) stayed here this past weekend. The hotel and staff were fantastic. From valet, to check-in, to room size and cleanliness, to that great free breakfast, and ease of access to Magnificent Mile activities - everything was top notch. We parked our van underneath and didn't use it till we left. We taxi-ed to our architectural boat tour then walked back to the hotel past, great shopping (got a pair of shoes on sale at Nordstrom), Garret's popcorn, Giordanno's, and the John Hancock Tower (which was the view out of our window). On our last day we could have walked to the Oak St. beach (we had just checked out so we parked around the corner near the beach instead). My biggest complaint might be that I probably could have stayed further south for less money. I say might because Lollapalooza was going on in Grant Park that weekend and rooms may not have been available or cheaper. And I may have missed easy access to some of the things I mentioned above. We might have enjoyed being closer to Navy Pier and the Museum campus. Note there is no pool at this hotel but for the summer time this didn't matter. Oh yes, we had a 1 bedroom king suite, with a sofa bed in the living room. Our bed was a bit soft (I think it was one of those memory foam mattresses). The kids seemed to do just fine. Also there is no "oven", just a cook top and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy spot in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: liz7614
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well maintained. The rooms are cozy and clean, and the beds are very comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions, and we asked a lot of questions! There is a wide assortment of items for breakfast, both hot and cold. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: chargersgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 3 kids and my parents in a 2 bedroom suite. It was a great stay. The location was perfect - walking distance to the Mag Mile and numerous restaurants. Since the hotel is on a street with residental buildings, it's very quite. The suite was roomy with two bedrooms, a kitchen and a living room. The front desk was very helpful when we were trying to find a good pizza place and pointed us to a few very good pizza places nearby. I also called housekeeping a couple times and they were always very quick with any request I had. I will definately return to Chicago and will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: mikez68
Reviews.Content: Free breakfast, free meals on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays (with beer and wine), very friendly staff, reasonable rates and and spacious rooms make this hotel a must if staying near the gold coast. the Mag mile, Hancock center, Navy Pier and Oak Street beach are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kaityogill
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel! We were lost in the parking lot and a very kind man pointed us the way out. He was the manager off duty! A very sweet maid greeted us on the way to our room. The room was very nicely decorated and very quiet. At breakfast the next morning the room was packed but the staff was so quick and friendly the tables were ready right away. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: softwaremom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during my week-long business trip to Chicago. The location of the hotel is wonderful - a short walk to everything: office near Millennium park sightseeing, threatre, and great restaurants. Rick Bayless's 3 restaurans are just 1 blocks away and I've visited them many times. There's night club just downstairs but I didn't hear any noise. Every afternoon they have free happy hours at the area next to the lobby. It is also where the free breakfast happens. The food is so, so, especially comparing to the meals I can get a block away but it's nice to sit and relax in the early evening. The room is big with a small but nice kitchen (which I didn't use) a nice desk, where I spent most of the time on, and a separate bedroom. For one person, it is way more room than I need but it felt like such a luxury. My room overlook the Chicago skyline to the east and it provides a nice break from the desk. Before staying there, I kept wondering if I should stay at the Springhill by Marriott, which shares the same entrance as Residence Inn or the later. I think I've made the right decision even though I don't need the extra kitchen. The full-size fridge allows me to store my dinner leftover and I can microwave it the next day. There're lots of families stayed in both hotel while I was there and I will do the same if I am to come back with my kids. At night, there are many people in sexy outfit outside because of the popular clubs nearby. It was quite a sight for someone from Seattle since we don't have the weather for those mini-skirts. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it will be back”
Reviews.Author: TDM41
Reviews.Content: Great location. Desk helpful Rooms neat ciomfortable and clean. Had separate elevator for pets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: llewis
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights here with college friends; a reunion after 30 years. The hotel was really very nice. The room was clean and extremely roomy. The kitchenette was modern and very efficient. The location was excellent for sightseeing. Each morning, the breakfast was more than adequate. They had hot food; eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, belgian waffles, breads and muffins, cereal, and the best oatmeal I think I've ever had. There was always coffee in the lobby. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. When I return to Chicago, I will definitely consider staying at this hotel again. It was a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagicFlute
Reviews.Content: This was very good. Room was comfortable with kitchen. Staff were helpful. Had to wait for the elevator sometimes but we were there at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxydogy
Reviews.Content: Clean, close enough to walk to the Magnificent Mile, breakfast and enough food at dinner dinner to feed a family. For adults I recommend eating out at any great Chicago Restaurant. My daughter enjoyed her time at The American Girl Store just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to eating and shopping!”
Reviews.Author: Befast_trip
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for convenience - it was just a walk to Grand park, where Blues Festival was going on, plus Rich Bayless's Xoco is right next block, as well as Michigan Avenue shops. Outstanding location, very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel. Tourists only.”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: First Residence Inn I've stayed at that had NO TABLE and NO DESK. A total joke as a business hotel. Sure, there's a free breakfast and lots of families and kids at the hotel. For business, I'd avoid this property. Fitness center not 24 hours. Not sure why. Cheesy plastic hangers in the closet. Not even a table for eating at. Only bar top. Worst R.I. I've experienced. Oh and sign on the HVAC points out that the system is on either heat or cooling depending on time of the year, so another reason to dodge the property in Spring and Fall. Heating is baseboards that CANNOT be turned off. LOL. Hotel should be priced at $99. Anything higher is a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: hallowoman
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago for a "get out of town" leisure trip for shopping and sight seeing. It took me a while to settle on this hotel but did so because of the location and the price relative to everything else in the area. It is close to Michigan Ave (2-3 minute walk - down the street from The Drake) and all of the fabulous shopping there is to offer. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Chicago red line station for those adverse to taxis. I requested an early check in which netted me a room directly outside the 5th floor elevator. I went back to reception and requested another room. I ended up on the pet floor (love animals) but the yappy mutt next door drove me back downstairs immediately. I decided to have my bags stored and wait for more rooms to open up. When I returned around 6:00 I was informed that I was being upgraded to a 1 bedroom to compensate for all my troubles. It was completely unexpected but much appreciated!! I would have been happy with my original room request in a quiet spot. Everything in the room was very clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a great selection with eggs, potatoes, sausage, all types of breads, waffles to make, fruit...the typical fully stocked breakfast buffet. It was nice to have access to a computer center as I chose to leave my laptop at home and pack more clothes. :-) I would definitely stay here again if I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, pleasing experience”
Reviews.Author: db2102
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise. My husband and I traveled to Chicago last month for a wedding, and we were looking to be as economical as possible. This hotel is right downtown, so we could walk to everything, and the rate was very competitive and included breakfast, which set it apart. Rooms were adorable - basically set up as a studio apartment: full kitchen, dining area, couch, coffee table, TV and dresser, king size bed, and a full bathroom with the closet and sink separate from the shower and toilet, which made getting ready very easy. Everything was clean and comfortable (one of the towels was dirty... but they replaced it). Two sets of elevators eases congestion around the front desk. Lobby area is huge and nice to relax in, as well as where breakfast is served, which was varied and of decent quality. They also have a sundries store and a business center. Both check in and check out were easy, and everyone was helpful. The rooms are a little small for a longer stay, but for a weekend trip, what a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just friggin...”
Reviews.Author: SugaTn
Reviews.Content: AWESOME! I have stayed in the Park Hyatt Chicago Downtown and I desired to stay in the Peninsula due to its high star rating, but I don't think I will be staying in either when I travel back to Chicago. The Residence Inn is where it's at for me. It's not on the Magnificient Mile but just right off from it and I think its location provides this hotel its charm factor. This hotel is just like an apartment in New York City! When we arrived, we were promptly greeted by valet, the front desk accomodated our requests, there's a small computer 'room' on the first floor (free of charge) and the complimentary breakfast will get you full- no bagels, no crossiants, but real breakfast food is available to you. The hotel staff were very pleasant and made our stay enjoyable. Great value all around. I shall return, lol!

Reviews.Title: “Cell Phone Scam / Revision”
Reviews.Author: LadyBiz
Reviews.Content: Correction to earlier review: No cell phone service in the rooms. All calls must be made in public places (i.e., the lobby) whether made to a client, a colleague (not a college as stated in previous review), your boss or a family member. The hotel indicates it has attempted to resolve the problem by installing a special cell phone antennae near the center of the building. My room was located in the center of the building. Unfortunately, the telephone reception was still non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family and friends”
Reviews.Author: buckeye1995
Reviews.Content: We went to this RI for a late family Christmas in January. The hotel was great and in an awesome location. We were very close to shopping, dining and nightlife. The rooms were a perfect size, even for our big family. The breakfast is great and helps save a lot of money, rather than going out. We are looking forward to going back to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Meister2
Reviews.Content: Great location for a suite hotel. Easy walk to Michigan Avenue. Great for families over the holiday. A good alternative to a standard hotel room. The Hertz rental office is steps away at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very clean hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: WalkerGirl2010
Reviews.Content: A group of us from Michigan rode the train to Chicago to have a "girls only" weekend. We did the Run for Chocolate Race, November, 2010. We started to plan for this trip in March 2010. We chose this hotel because of the suites (we shared rooms) and the proximity to shopping, restuarants, events, etc. As the list of gals who wanted to come grew, the hotel was extremely accomodating to "add ons". The staff was extremly polite and very helpful. This is a pet friendly hotel, but you wouldn't know it. It is very clean...an absolute must for me!! The unanimous decision was that this will be an annual event and this will be our hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: mifan011
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn (River North - 410 N. Dearborn) this past weekend for the Hot Chocolate 15 k race in Grant Park. The hotel staff was outstanding - probably the best I've ever had at any property and I travel a lot with my husband. The hotel is only 2 years old - built in 2008 and it is a beautiful, well-maintained hotel. The rooms were spacious - we had a 2 bedroom suite and very tastefully appointed. The check-in staff was very friendly and efficient and the woman who worked at the morning buffet was incredibly accommodating. Our race was on Sat Nov 6 and she opened up the buffet at 6 am that morning (it usually is open at 7:30 am) just for our large group to be able to have a bagel, coffee and fruit before we walked over to the race. I can't say enough great things about the reservation staff we worked with (Melinda and Allyson), Naomi the front desk clerk and everyone we encountered at the hotel. If you are looking for a great hotel that truly knows what customer service is, you can't go wrong at the Marriott Residence Inn- River North.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: kminichan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner suite on the 16th floor. Wonderful location, service, breakfast, and amenities. Highly recommend it for families visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Buffy24
Reviews.Content: My friend & I went to Chicago for her 60th birthday. We loved the Residence Inn! Only one block to Michigan Avenue, the location was wonderful. There were only 3 other hotels & condos on our street, so it was clean and safe. The bus stop for Chicago Transit is just 2 blocks down. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, even the sofabed! We were on the 19th floor, so we could see the lake and Oak Street beach from our window. Check in was quick and easy, we arrived at 10:45 a.m. and were able to get into our room right away. Breakfast in the morning was plentiful. I will definitely consider the Residence Inn for my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to our USA holiday”
Reviews.Author: Macrihanish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we loved it. It is tucked away in an elegant residential street but close to all the tourist stuff. Room was large and had a fully equipped kitchen. Very quiet with a huge, comfortable bed and walk in shower. We knew that breakfast was complimentary but were surprised to find that some nights there was complimentary food in the evening too. This was very welcome after a hard day sightseeing in beautiful Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Low End Hotel Large Room, great location Half block from Lake Shore Drive”
Reviews.Author: ROCKintheUSA
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on short Chicago Stay. I have few compliments for the hotel other than the room was large and it has a great location only half a block from Lake Shore Drive so great for morning runs along Lake Michigan. Now, to the hotel. Lobby wasdecent, service fine, room size was large. About 750 sq ft/1 BR suite with fold out sofa bed, electric stove, full size fridge and microwave. Comp breakfast, fine selection, fre coffeemaker. However, celings are popcorn, rugs were ratty, furniture old and rather nasty and bed was very uncomcofrtable. View was fine, nothing great. Had convenience stor in lobby with usurous rates. There's a bodega round the corner in the basement level so go there for food, booze. One thing i HATED was that this place WELCOMES pets. In fact, they have a segregated pet elevator, Now, I love dogs,m but what kind of tool travels with a dog. There was a yapping dog on our floor which I wanted to strangle. I don't mind kids at all, but I draw the line at having to share a hotel with dogs. It's really an "Eff You" to most of us who do not travel with dogs. Having said that, and realizing that Chicago is a pricey town (much to my syrprise), you could easily stay somewhere outside the downtown area and be just as satisfied because you can get pretty much anywhere in downtown Chicago for like a $7 cab ride or a short ride on the El. However, the Chicago subway system is not really as ubiquitousas say the NYC subway system so in spots you have to walk quite a bit to get to a station. I'd stay here again for around $150 a night. I paid around $225 all in. I've stayed in Marriott Residence Inns elsewhere and they were nicer properties. There's a Hilton Suites across the street and although pricier, it's much nicer than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, and the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sisterofmoses
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel and we were in AWE at its location. Close enough to walk the Magnificent Mile or choose to walk along the beach. Clean rooms, open floorplan with kitchen, and a breakfast with lots of options (not just carbs!). Loved it, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected. Great location and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: arthuradesign
Reviews.Content: I searched long and hard for the right hotel for our long weekend to Chicago. I was looking at several boutique hotels but I found the perfect place. We stayed in a condo style studio with a king size bed. It was perfect for us and it felt like our home away from home. The hotel room was perfect size with a large shower and free internet. The full kitchen was a great plus and the room was very clean and fresh. We didn't have a car during our trip and we didn't need one with the great location and public transit nearby. The hotel is on a quiet street just two short blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The check-in was a little long because they had trouble with the computers but the staff was great and very helpful. The free breakfast was good. We were overly impressed by everything about this hotel and had a great trip. We will remember this hotel for our future trips to Chicago and definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: s2kazi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing location right next to all the major shopping and nightlife areas in Chicago's downtown area. There is a really nice beach right at downtown Chicago which is a 2 minute walk away from the hotel as well! The hotel staff was extremely friendly and free WIFI and morning breakfast was an added bonus on top! The rooms were spacious and comfortable as well. The only real downside was the valet parking which was a ridiculous $45 per night. I'd recommend looking for public lots elsewhere if you plan to drive to Chicago. Another strange design issue with us was that the sink was outside the washroom, but that is nothing major to be concerned about. Aside from that, everything else was just perfect. We would go back and stay here for sure if we ever return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and nice. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Wisc2000
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite was spacious and nice. Nice kitchen with a granite countertop. Well laid-out. Nicely furnished. Large breakfast buffet, but lots of guests. The hotel is located just off Michigan Avenue next to the Knickerbocker and just down the street from The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet servers were very rude and unpleasant, everything else was good.”
Reviews.Author: fumsbowo
Reviews.Content: I don't know if they are understaffed, or overworked, or just had bad days every time I ate there, but the folks who staffed the buffet for breakfast and dinner were unbelievably rude. Not to everyone, but to a lot of people, a lot of the time. They were rude to the woman who had the temerity to ask for cream cheese ten minutes before breakfast was supposed to end, rude to the woman who couldn't find the ketchup, rude to the guy who had a question about the waffle maker, and boy am I glad I'm not the guy who tried to grab a something from their little fridge at dinner ("That's for breakfast!"). Breakfast and dinner are both offered for relatively short windows of time, and about half an hour before the meals are supposed to end, they stop restocking. One woman on the staff turned away one poor guest who came down for breakfast slightly later than 9:30 (he came down at 9:35 according to my phone, but apparently was 10 minutes late if you go by the "official" clock by the reception desk), and then she immediately turned around and started urgently dumping the trays of danish and muffins in the trash. She couldn't have at least offered that guy one of the muffins that she was about to throw away? It created a really unpleasant atmosphere in which to eat. Who wants to have their food served up to them by such hostile, unpleasant people? I ended up spending money going out. The ultimate irony was the weekend morning when one of the servers sang what she called their "mission statement." All about how great their service is, and how the guests "tell stories about us." Oh, I've been telling my friends stories about them, all right, but not good ones... In their defense, they seemed to be extremely busy -- maybe they are so understaffed that it's a huge ordeal just each meal out, and maybe anyone would get crabby under the circumstances. I definitely think the hotel needs to expand the amount of time they serve breakfast and dinner, to avoid the frantic crush of people all trying to grab food at the same time, and they should probably add a staff person or two (or rearrange the shifts). But, yeah, the service on the buffet was pretty awful, awful enough to motivate me to write my first negative review. (And while I'm complaining: they always stop putting out plates after the first 30-40 minutes or so, and anyone who comes later has to eat off paper plates. It's a lot nicer (and less wasteful) to eat off real plates with real silverware. The hotel internet (both wifi and ethernet) was slow and glitchy, and, since it's a hotel that supposedly caters to business travelers, they should really fix that. I'm still giving three stars, because everything else -- room size, room cleanliness, location, etc. -- was good, and every single other hotel employee I dealt with for the whole stay was very nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great location”
Reviews.Author: CapeTown78
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the airport quite jetlagged with a small baby. Very friendly service, well stocked 1 bedroom suite with black out curtains that meant our baby could sleep regardless of the time of day! Very helpful staff and close to shops, sights and essentials like a pharmacy as we needed something for our baby. Not much of a view but loved the free manager's meal in the evening as we were too tired to go out. Breakfast was pretty standard but still offered plenty. It was a great base to explore the city and the price was reasonable for Chicago too as we booked direct and got quite a discount. We also went for a swim in the morning and were the only ones there!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for fun in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: If you want a GREAT location for seeing Chicago as a tourist this is it. One block from Hancock Center and Water Tower. Close to buses, but a bit of a walk to El. Close to water Lakeshore Drive and Lincoln Park too. Really decent breakfast but a bit crowded and needed more fresh fruit. Evening food half the week too. Quiet and solid but not beautiful building. Good competent friendly staff. We saw everything and got good rest each night. Not really a business hotel. Our room did not have tub, only shower. Nice kitchen and full size refrigerator. Good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: cilly28
Reviews.Content: We are a family with young children and it was important for us to have a hotel with kitchen amenities. The Residence Inn by the Marriott had a full kitchen with a two-element stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, all the dishes and pots you need and even a juice container for your juice in the fridge. The hotel is located in the north end of the Magnificent Mile and within walking distance to all the tourist sites. It was only a 25 minute walk to Navy Pier and the John Hancock Tower and Water Tower are just down the street. Another reason we selected this hotel is the daily breakfast served. The variety in the breakfast buffet was fantastic, offering a wide-range of hot and cold foods. The only criticism is the short time span you have to go down and get your breakfast. Overall, we were more than pleased to have chosen this hotel and will return for a stay should we ever visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sister Trip”
Reviews.Author: Canoe4770
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn on Walton is north of downtown in the Gold Coast area, Very nice, clean hotel in quiet/safe Gold Coast area. Room looks to be recently renovated with great little kitchette area (even a dishwasher) with comfy beds and comfortable living space. They have a fairly decent breakfast buffet, including a waffle station. Some variety in the hot food (scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage) would be nice, but good selection of other food. Staff are always pleasant and helpful. Very near Michigan Avenue, Visitors Center, and CTA transportation. Little grocery store around the corner came in handy. We took the Blue Line/Bus 66 and then walked 4 blocks to the hotel (from O;Hare) to save $$ - a lot easier than it sounds. Bought the Chicago Go Card - which saved us lots of $$ also. Our only complaint was being put in a room (306) near the elevator on the 3rd floor with a view of a roof with puddles of water and an apartment building. Considering I made the reservations months in advance and am a Marriott member - I expected more. I have to admit, though, there was no noise from the elevator - probably because everyone else had rooms on the higher floors. We were not able to check in until 4 pm - which is their listed check-in time. The hotel does have a wine reception on some nights - but only Tues- Thurs I believe, which did not work out for our schedule. Overall, a nice hotel and we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: nld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in April. We were going to see the Oprah show. It is not near her studio but only a 10minute cab ride away. It was however very convenient for shopping the Miracle Mile. It is only one block away from it. There are many restaurants and attractions nearby as well. The Hancock tower is within walking distance as is the Water Tower. The rooms are very modern and nice. We stayed in a King Studio and it was a quite large and very clean. The shower and toilet are separate from the vanity/sink area which was very convenient. As someone can shower while another dries their hair which is very beneficial when the girls are travelling together. The breakfast was perfect for us. Offering warm and cold items. They had a managers reception night and a bbq night while we there. It included food and beer for both. I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shuli52769
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with four other girls and the only complaint I have is that the elevators get packed when everyone rushes down to get the great breakfast in the mornings. Dennis Hambright was very friendly and had great recommendations for us to see and do - the hotel was very quick to remedy a minor issue with plumbing and brought ice and extra pillows and towels very quickly when requested. The breakfasts were great (you get serenaded by the staff) and the hotel even had a Mexican buffet for dinner one night. Very convenient to Water Tower, Magnificent Mile and John Hancock Building. Place also seemed very dog friendly as we saw quite a few coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Got what I expected and a little more”
Reviews.Author: PassOut76
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a little relaxation and a little business. Needed a room with 2 beds, most were quite expensive. The Residence Inn had a bed and a hide-a-bed. We took a corner room on an upper floor. Our timing was the biggest problem as we had a mini-van full of stuff and needed to conduct our business starting at noon at a place we really were not familiar with in downtown Chicago. So the best thing was the Residence Inn let us check in at 10:30 in the morning. That was a huge help and much appreciated. The doorman was very helpful in getting us to the room and pointing out a quick place for breakfast. It is kind of a hassle to check in as the desk is on the floor above street level. So you have to take the lobby elevators to the floor then another set of elevators to your room. It is a bit time consuming but a nice security feature. The room was just fine, just what you might expect at a Residence inn with a small kitchenette, small dining/work table, and a sleeping area with the sofa. All were very comfortable. As with every hide-a-bed, the bar in the middle drives you nuts when you extend out the bed. So we pulled the mattress off the hide-a-bed and put it on the floor for sleeping. The king-size bed probably could have fit all three of my wife, my son and I but ... The internet connection worked great. The iron, coffee maker, tv, temp control, shower, etc. all worked just fine. Being downtown was a little loud but expected. We used the hot tub, it was not overly hot and not overly crowded. The breakfast was good, I made a waffle and the sausages were fine. The coffee was less than mediocre. For Parking, I parked at a self-park place a block away and saved about $8. But it is still $28 for the weekend day. That's a real pain in the wallet. The location though is very convenient to everything in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property for families”
Reviews.Author: MadTownTraveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the great staff at this property. They were pleasant, helpful and informative. The hotel is in a great spot for Michigan Avenue and Rush Street. Near to Lakeshore Drive. Navy Pier is a healthy walk away, and the Shedd, etc., are not walkable, but the amenities and staff make up for that. The valet parking, while expensive (it is Chicago after all), was very responsive. The staff reminded us of free dinner on Thursday night when we arrived. The taco bar that night was just fine and well-stocked, as was breakfast each day. The two bedroom suite was great for our family of five. The frontdesk helped with restaurant recommendations and with a discount coupon for one of them. Very near to Michigan Avenue shopping and the Hancock tower. Key recommendation: if you're hitting the museums, get the CityPass. It saves time and money. We avoided an hour wait at the Hancock and got rock star treatment in the fast line at each museum. Great stay at an excellent Marriott property

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: IndyTraveler49
Reviews.Content: I would like to Thank the wonderful staff at the Residence Inn Downtown Chicago. I had a great time. Front Desk Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Also a" Great Thank You" to" Ismeha" a Residence Inn Breakfast Staff Member. Every morning Ismeha was Warm, Pleasant and Very Helpful. Thank You Marriott Residence Inn for a Wonderful Vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: caschic
Reviews.Content: Really great family friendly hotel. Staff very helpful and polite - esp welcoming at breakfast (Ismerta loves kids). Rooms clean and small kitchens great - they let you take milk, yoghurt and fruit from breakfast. Pool for kids on top floor a real plus. Great location. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel16
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better hotel for our trip. We booked a two bedroom suite, which was bigger than most apartments. The beds were comfortable, living area large and inviting, the kitchen was perfect for our needs. The fridge even has an automatic ice maker. It takes a while to get going, but once it did, we had plenty of ice for our three night stay. Employees are incredibly friendly, especially the doormen. The only negative, is the expensive parking...ouch...but we understand that this is typical for Chicago. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. Hogg Family, Collingwood, ON, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to find short term housing when our condo caught on fire during the summer. Staying out in the suburbs wasn't an option for us, so the Res Inn on Walnut made the most sense. Plus, they are dog friendly. While the circumstances of our stay put a damper on everything, we managed to make the most of spending a month in a hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay. The king suite was very roomy and comfortable. Lots of places to throw our stuff and hang our clothes. The bathroom/vanity area had lots of drawers to store all of the items we needed for the month. The internet was free and easy to use. It was helpful to have an equipped kitchen so we could make our own meals. They provided towels, clothe napkins, etc... Although I don't think they had dishsoap....that would have been helpful. They also had activities from time to time in the lobby. Whether it be a "nacho bar Thursday" or "guest appreciation cocktail hour", it was nice to have events built into the week. This is a good hotel if you're traveling w/a group or over a longer duration of time. It's near a lot of main bus lines and not too far from the L. Plus, Oak St Beach is right around the corner! It's also easy to get to the bike path.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice, Would stay again and highly suggest!”
Reviews.Author: boynegirl2400
Reviews.Content: After many hours of reading reviews of many choices I picked the best Hotel for us. Everyone was so helpful and extremely nice. The room was awesome, clean, great view,fantastically comfy beds, wonderful breakfast. A few quirky things happened like our room key didn't work a few times I think because it was held next to a cell phone, a no no, it will delete your room info. We had to call the main desk from our 21st floor elevator phone for help, they were there within seconds to help us. No worries, you have to have ID though before they will let you in the room, or get it once the door opened, a good policy I must say. And the hot tub closed early one night for maintence when we really needed it. The next day they must have put too many chemicals in it cause my legs to break out and itched terribly. I didnt go back in it after that. We ate breakfast on the suite side. There is a definet difference from the residence and the suites in the lobby and the breakfast. The difference is in the comfort of the chairs in the eating area and computer area, not the staff though. Upon our departure we had several hours before our train departure. They were without question happy to hold onto our luggage after check out while we continued to shop Michigan Avenue. This was a wonderful experience. Save yourself any further checking into other hotels, this is your best bang for your buck. I'm very frugal and picky too.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West of the Drink, East of the Swamp
Reviews.Title: “3-star hotel in a 5-star location”
Reviews.Author: LarryAt27N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Walton, the next street south of Oak, and located midway between the Drive and Michigan Avenue. In the dead of winter, we easily walked to the Drury Lane Theater at Water Tower Place and to the Spiaggia restaurants: 5 minutes tops. Over the holiday week, the place was jammed with families enjoying the city And several dogs were to be seen, but we heard not one. Our high, north-facing room was spacious and bright, with a full kitchen and breakfast bar. The 'fridge was a great place to store leftovers, which we reheated in the microwave for lunch a couple of days later. The free breakfast buffet was surprisingly good and hearty, lacking only bacon which only my wife missed. We made waffles our last morning there. The other mornings were standard American fare for me and yogurt concoctions for her...all washed down with good hot, fresh coffee or tea. Free newspapers made it feel like home. Note: the breakfast area can get crowded after 8:30 if the hotel is stuffed full of guests. Staff is courteous, helpful, and friendly, and the price was very right. I should state that this is not a place for hotel snobs, but if you want to save $$$ to pay for the city's pricier restaurants, this is the place to lay your head down. Only two complaints: 1. Wimpy shower 2. Sucky wi-fi system, just like our recent Marriott stay in Pasadena. By way of comparison, in between Marriotts, we stayed at a hotel in Palm Beach and I was on line in 30 seconds.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated with issues...”
Reviews.Author: Tredpositive
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are newly renovated with nice living room area open to wonderful kitchen space fully stocked for extended stays ie dishes, silverware, glasses, pans, utensils, full size refrig, microwave, small dishwasher, small oven and two or four electric burners, etc. the layout/design with placement of bathroom is extremely poor and undesirable! Don't care if you are staying with your long time spouse, family members, date or friends, who in the world thought ANYONE would want to exist from tiny combo tub/shower with tight fitted toilet to a FULLY EXPOSED raised sink and mirror, open across from kitchen and living room areas???!!! Not to mention you will boil in the tight tub/shower/toilet room with no fan with no room to move, to stepping out into freezing open sink/mirror tiny exposed cube area. Most anyone will have to lean into the mirror to shave or women apply makeup over the deep counter top, WATCH your ELBOWS on the raised sink bowl, unless you are really tall ! If you forgot something from your suitcase in the bedroom, let's run in front of everyone around wall into bedroom and back again to sink/mirror. On top of all that, their towels are smallish, thin and rough. Moving on from the lack of bathroom privacy and proper space to function. The separate bedroom is spacious with plenty of closet space and one dresser with few drawers that the large flat screen hdtv sits atop.
